reviewText: I have done aerobics my whole life and been dancing for some time as well.  I'm not really a hip-hop dancer although I've wanted to get into it for some time.  Whenever you buy an aerobic dance video you want to get a work-out and learn some cool new moves to try out on the dance floor.  This video will do neither.  I bought at the behest of my boyfriend who assured me that she is a great dancer.  While that might be true, she should completely stay away from instruction.Good instructional videos must have steady camera angles where you can see the whole moves consistently.  They can not bounce around b/c it confuses the viewer and limits the viewing of the moves.  This video mostly shows her from the waist up which is awful since you are supposed to be looking at her feet.  Mostly this is to show off how sexy and cool she looks rather than actually try to show you anything at all.Of course it is mandatory to have clear, concise instructions on all facets of new moves.  This includes feet placement, how to step, where your toes should point, hip placement and counting correctly to the rhythm.  She does NONE of this well.  Her counting is off big time and doesn't match her steps.  There are times when all she does is count and not instruct at all.  .Also her instructions don't match her movements.  A good instructor will tell you to step with your right while she steps with her left.  Why? Because she is in front of you and her actions need to mirror yours.  So when she tells you to step with your right it should look like it's on the right side to you.  She doesn't do this at all and actually forgets to mention the left or right altogether after a while.A bit more than half-way through both videos I shut them off because they were totally pointless and a waste of my life.  I've learned more watching people in clubs and got a better workout walking to the store to pick up this video.  Save your money and buy videos from people who made their money instructing instead of taking their clothes off.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found carmens tape boring and I hated the way she kept saying 'one two one two' and doing the same movements over and over and over. The backround was empty and no one was there with her. It was a bore. I would use another dvd any day over Carmen.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video is a fun workout and can be as strenuous or as easy as you want it to be. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to mix up their workout routine and add something a little sexy and different. Give yourself a lot of space to have fun with this video--it isn't as fun or as good of a workout if you're stuck in a very confined space.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I expected to break a sweat, but this isn't all that strenuous. The lap dance is a "good enough" workout to supplement real workout on alternate days, but in all I was dissappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The best thing about the Carmen Electra videos is that they are different and not boring.  But the $50 box set is paying for a lot more than you are really getting.  The routines are all fairly easy.  Only the hip hop disc will really get you sweating.  The "Advanced Strip" is more sexy poses and props than exercise.Kathy Smith is not as sexy as Carmen Electra, but she'll get you more results if you are looking to lose weight.
summary: Fun and different, but not perfect
Title: N/A

reviewText: I ordered this dvd because back in 2008 i use to work out to it over and over when it was on Comcast on Demand.The only thing i was really disappointed in was the background music, when I first started working out to it, it had a J.Lo upbeat background song that was fun to workout and listen to. I thought it still had that but when i put the dvd in i noticed the music had changed, it really didnt go with the work out at all. All and all id give this dvd 4 stars.
summary: love the work out but the music didnt make it fun
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this with two goals in mind. Learn some sexy moves and get a great workout. I did feel like I learned a few good moves on the first DVD for my hubby, but this is the LAMEST workout ever! She walks you through the steps and then you go over it a few times, it is short. I have only done the 1st half of the hip hop DVD because I can't stand the way she talks or goes through the moves. I just can't bring myself to waste the time. Don't buy this DVD. It was such a waste of money.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD was vastly disappointing. I wish I had heeded all the reviews I had read online - on Amazon or fitness message boards, but decided to give it a chance because the hip hop segment.This isn't a workout but more of an instructional dance routine, which seems somewhat contrived at that. I have only done it one time, which as it is was enough to learn the whole routine. You also do not quite get smoothness to the routine - it is always stop-and-go, granted it is to learn the steps but it was overdone and made things tedious (and not fun) .. things one does not quite want in a dance workout.If you are looking at this DVD for a workout, please look elsewhere. I recommend the Quick Fix Hip Hop for a good solid dance workout. If you're looking for a stripping/dance routine .. look towards the S Factor series.
summary: Not quite what it strives to be
Title: N/A
